command: docker run --rm --net=host --cap-add=NET_ADMIN alpine sh -c "apk add --no-cache iptables >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 161 -m string --string 'private-knock-7443' --algo bm -j LOG --log-prefix 'T1205_SNMP_SIG ' --log-level 4 && iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 161 -m string --string 'private-knock-7443' --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_snmp --set && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 7443 -m recent --name t1205_snmp --rcheck --seconds 60 --reap -j ACCEPT"
explanation: Matches an SNMP community-like string 'private-knock-7443' on UDP/161 as the covert signal. On detection, logs it and briefly opens TCP/7443 to the sender, using application-specific SNMP content.
rationale_steps: Manipulate host firewall from Docker without root by granting NET_ADMIN.
Inspect SNMP payload for a specific community string used as a knock.
Permit TCP/7443 for 60 seconds for the source that signaled.
